2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out);\n```\nThe previous code attempt did not verify: \n```C```C\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out)\n{\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n\n    int moves_right = ((n -                     "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int moves_right = (a % 2 == 0) ?                     "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n\n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n\n    if (a % 2 == 0) {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    } else {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out);\n```\nThe previous code attempt did not verify: \n```C```C\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out)\n{\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n\n    int moves_right = ((n -                     "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n\n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n\n    int total_moves = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n\n    if (a % 2 == 0) {\n        //@ assert evenRouteSolution(n, a, total_moves);\n        //@ assert !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, total_moves);\n    } else {\n        //@ assert oddRouteSolution(n, a, total_moves);\n        //@ assert !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, total_moves);\n    }\n\n    *out = total_moves;\n}\n",

                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n\n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n\n    if (a % 2 == 0) {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    } else {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out);\n```\nThe previous code attempt did not verify: \n```C```C\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out)\n{\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n\n    int moves_right = ((n -                     "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n\n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n\n    *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n}\n",

                    "tokens_used": 2312,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    int even_out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    int odd_out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left - 1;\n    \n    if (a % 2 == 0) {\n        *out = even_out;\n    } else {\n        *out = odd_out;\n    }\n}\n\n",

                    "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    int sum_moves = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    \n    if (a % 2 == 0) {\n        *out = sum_moves;\n    } else {\n        *out = sum_moves - 1;\n    }\n}\n",

That is, no for, while, do-while or recursive loops\n\nYou are given the following problem description. You must return the code in the following format:\n```C\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out);\n```\nThe previous code attempt did not verify: \n```C```C\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out)\n{\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    if (a % 2 == 0) {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    } else {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left - 1;\n    }\n}\n`````` The following feedback was given: \nThe verification timed out. Timeouts: 4 of 36.\n The following lines caused the timeouts:\nGoal Post-condition for 'a_is_even'  does not hold:         ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\nGoal Post-condition for 'a_is_even'  does not hold:         ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\nGoal Post-condition for 'a_is_odd'  does not hold:         ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\nGoal Post-condition for 'a_is_odd'  does not hold:         ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n. Please try to solve the problem.\nPlease improve the code such that it formally verifies.\nPlease generate the formally verified C code adhering to the problem description.",
                    "max_tokens_used": 4096,
                    "model_used": "t",
                    "gpt_output": "```C\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out)\n{\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    \n    if (a % 2 == 1) {\n        *out = *out - 1;\n    }\n}\n```",
                    "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    \n    if (a % 2 == 1) {\n        *out = *out - 1;\n    }\n}\n",

                    "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    if (a % 2 == 1) {\n        *out -= 1;\n    }\n}\n",
                    "feedback": "The verification timed out. Please try to solve the problem.",

That is, no for, while, do-while or recursive loops\n\nYou are given the following problem description. You must return the code in the following format:\n```C\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out);\n```\nThe previous code attempt did not verify: \n```C```C\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out)\n{\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    if (a % 2 == 0) {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    } else {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left - 1;\n    }\n}\n`````` The following feedback was given: \nThe verification timed out.                     "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int moves_right = (n - That is, no for, while, do-while or recursive loops\n\nYou are given the following problem description. 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out);\n```\nThe previous code attempt did not verify: \n```C```C\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out)\n{\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    if (a % 2 == 0) {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    } else {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left - 1;\n    }\n}\n`````` The following feedback was given: \nThe verification timed out.                     "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    int additional_moves = (a % 2 == 0) ? 0 : -1;\n    \n    *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left + additional_moves;\n}\n",

2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n -                     "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n\n    int additional_moves = 0;\n    if (a % 2 == 1) {\n        additional_moves = -1;\n    }\n    \n    *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left + additional_moves;\n}\n",

2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n -                     "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    if (a % 2 == 0) {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    } else {\n        *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out);\n```\nThe previous code attempt did not verify: \n```C```C\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out)\n{\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n -                     "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n\n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n\n    *out = 1 + moves_right + moves_left - !is_even;\n}\n",

2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out);\n```\nThe previous code attempt did not verify: \n```C```C\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out)\n{\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n -                     "tokens_used": 0,
                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerEvenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = ((n - a) / 2) * is_even + ((a - 1) / 2) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = (n - a + 1) / 2;\n    \n    int result = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    if (a % 2 == 1) {\n        result -= 1;\n    }\n    \n    *out = result;\n}\n",

                    "code": "/*\n    The main street of Berland is a straight line with n houses built along it (n is an even number). The houses are located at both sides of the street. The houses with odd numbers are at one side of the street and are numbered from 1 to n - 1 in the order from the beginning of the street to the end (in the picture: from left to right). The houses with even numbers are at the other side of the street and are numbered from 2 to n in the order from the end of the street to its beginning (in the picture: from right to left). The corresponding houses with even and odd numbers are strictly opposite each other, that is, house 1 is opposite house n, house 3 is opposite house n - 2 , house 5 is opposite house n - 4 and so on. Vasya needs to get to house number a as quickly as possible. He starts driving from the beginning of the street and drives his car to house a . To get from the beginning of the street to houses number 1 and n , he spends exactly 1 second. He also spends exactly one second to drive the distance between two neighbouring houses. Vasya can park at any side of the road, so the distance between the beginning of the street at the houses that stand opposite one another should be considered the same. Your task is: find the minimum time Vasya needs to reach house a.\n\n    Input\n    The input contains two integers, n and a (1 \u2264 a \u2264 n \u2264 100000) \u2014 the number of houses on the street and the number of the house that Vasya needs to reach, correspondingly. It is guaranteed that number n is even.\n\n    Output\n    Output a single integer \u2014 the minimum time Vasya needs to get from the beginning of the street to house a.\n*/\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an even number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate evenRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == n - 2 * moves_right + 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n// This predicate ensures that if the house is an odd number that it is reached\n/*@ predicate oddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left == out;\n*/\n\n/*@ predicate smallerOddRouteSolution(int n, int a, int out) =\n    \\exists integer moves_right, moves_left;\n    0 <= moves_right <= n &&\n    0 <= moves_left <= n &&\n    a == 1 + 2 * moves_right - 2 * moves_left && // Ensure that the solution ends at a\n    1 + moves_right + moves_left < out;\n*/\n\n/*@\n    requires \\valid(out);\n    requires 1 <= a <= n <= 100000;\n    requires n % 2 == 0;\n    assigns *out;\n    behavior a_is_even:\n        assumes a % 2 == 0;\n        ensures evenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerEvenRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    behavior a_is_odd:\n        assumes a % 2 == 1;\n        ensures oddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n        ensures !smallerOddRouteSolution(n, a, *out);\n    complete behaviors;\n    disjoint behaviors;\n*/\nvoid calculateMinimumTimeToHouse(int n, int a, int *out) {\n    int is_even = a % 2 == 0;\n    \n    int moves_right = CALCULATE_MOVES_RIGHT(n, a) * is_even + CALCULATE_MOVES_LEFT(n, a) * !is_even;\n    int moves_left = CALCULATE_MOVES_LEFT(n, a);\n    \n    int total_moves = 1 + moves_right + moves_left;\n    \n    if (a % 2 == 0) {\n        *out = total_moves;\n    } else {\n        *out = total_moves -
